start.0: Welcome to the Blades in the Dark's telegram Bot by : Niccoló Bergamaschi, Gabriele Brenna and Leandro Bognanni.
start.1: License {} : This work is based on Blades in the Dark (found at http://www.bladesinthedark.com/), product of One Seven Design, developed and authored by John Harper, and licensed for our use under the Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported license (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/).
start.2:
Create a group chat with your friends and invite them all to 
/login.
 After the registration you can start playing.
 If you have any questions, pls use 
/help

greet_chat_members.0: Scoundrel {} was bragged to Doskvol by {}

default.0: 🔪HELP SECTION🔪 For more info about complex commands (marked with 🔎), type /help followed by the name of the command
default.1: -GENERAL- /start - welcome message with credits and bot's starting instruction. /login - register your telegram account by choosing an username. /join - joins in a game of this chat. 🔎
default.2: -CREATION- /createGame - create a new game in this chat. /createPC - starts the creation of a PC. 🔎 /createCrew - starts the creation of the crew. 🔎
default.3: -DICE- /roll [N] - rolls N dice and returns the result. 🔎

commands.createpc: Starts the creation of a PC. The information required during this conversation are the PC's name, alias, background, heritage, class, vice and optionally a more detailed description. The new created character is stored in your personal data and you can join any game you want with him.
commands.createcrew: Starts the creation of the crew. The information required during this conversation are the crew's type, name, reputation, lair location and description, special ability, a contact and optionally 2 starting upgrades and a more detailed description. You can use this command only if you joined a game in this chat. The new created crew will become the crew of the game you joined in this chat. If a crew was already present, it is replaced by the new one.
commands.join:
When you join a game you can decide to join with a PC of yours or as the Game Master. If you decide to join with a PC, you'll be redirected in your private chat to complete the PC creation. You can join several times the same game with different PCs. Keep in mind that you can join only a game per chat at time.
If you join as Master you'll become the new GM; if a GM was already present he will be substituted (If he had no PCs he is removed from the Game).
commands.roll: You can roll a specified pool of dice (for instance: /roll 6 will roll 6d6). You will see all your dice rolling in the form of stickers, then the final result according to Blades in the Dark rules (The highest result, CRIT or the lowest result if you rolled a pool of '0' dice).

bonus_dice.message: Add or remove your bonus dice. By now you have {} 🎲
bonus_dice.extended: If you have a special ability, a Claim or something else that can give you an help, you can modify the number of bonus dice you get.
bonus_dice.vice_message: Adjust the outcome of the roll.
bonus_dice.vice_extended: If you have a special ability, a Claim or something else that can give you an help, you can modify the outcome of the roll.
bonus_dice.score: Select the number of dice you want to roll. You start with 1 dice of sheer luck.
bonus_dice.engagement_extended: Select the number of dice you want to roll. Consider the details of your plan.
bonus_dice.heat: Select the amount of heat to add or remove.
bonus_dice.heat_description: Change the amount of heat your crew will receive. Consider your abilities/crew's abilities.
bonus_dice.rep: Select the amount of rep to add to your crew.
bonus_dice.rep_description: If you kept this operation completely quiet you should earn 0 Rep. If you have a Special Ability or a Claim that gives you extra Rep, you can mark it.
bonus_dice.vault_capacity_message: Select the total capacity of your crew's vault:
bonus_dice.vault_capacity_rules: By the game rules, the default capacity of the crew's vault is 4. If your crew has the Vault Upgrade, the capacity can be increased to 8 (level 1) or to 16 (level 2). If you have something that can give you more space or something that reduces it, mark the value of your vault's capacity.
bonus_dice.factions_status_message: Modify the status your crew has with this faction:
bonus_dice.factions_status_description: The status represents your relationship with another faction. It goes from -3 (War) to 3 (Allies)
bonus_dice.fortune_roll_extended: If you have something that can give you an help (special abilities, crew upgrades, etc), you can modify the number of bonus dice you get. For example: if you are rolling the quality of an item that is fine you can add 1 die

controlled.CRIT: You do it with increased effect.
controlled.4,5: You hesitate. Withdraw and try a different approach, or else do it with a minor consequence: a minor complication occurs, you have reduced effect, you suffer a lesser harm, you end up in a risky position.
controlled.1,2,3: You falter. Press on by seizing a risky opportunity, or withdraw and try a different approach.

risky.CRIT: You do it with increased effect.
risky.4,5: You do it, but there's a consequence: you suffer harm, a complication occurs, you have reduced effect, you end up in a desperate position.
risky.1,2,3: Things go badly. You suffer harm, a complication occurs, you end up in a desperate position, you lose this opportunity.

desperate.CRIT: You do it with increased effect.
desperate.4,5: You do it, but there's a consequence: you suffer severe harm, a serious complication occurs, you have reduced effect.
desperate.1,2,3: It's the worst outcome. You suffer severe harm, a serious complication occurs, you lose this opportunity  for action.

others.CRIT: You do it with increased effect.
others.4,5: You do it, but there's a consequence.

engagement.CRIT: you've already overcome the first obstacle and you're in a controlled position
engagement.6: you are in a controlled position when the action starts
engagement.4,5: you are in a risky position when the action starts
engagement.1,2,3: you are in a desperate position when the action starts
